content.description: Highball slab classic. Tricky with the crux coming at mid-height. Falls from here are big but reasonable. Falling above this would be unpleasant.
content.location: Looking at the ridge point from below, this is on the right side.

content.description: Start on the small ledges. Move up through the brick shaped pinch to a vertical face. topout
content.protection: Land is decent a few pads should do
content.location: 200 feet uphill from the Great Arete
To the right of Infinity Dollars

content.description: Start under the small overhang. Work right through small seams then up to a bigger seam. Topout at/around the point
content.location: Further right and slightly downhill from the Big Hiest

content.description: Climb the slab left or right.
content.location: If you're standing below the ridge, looking at Ironborne and Coffer, continue to the right below the ridge.

content.description: Sit Start with left on a sloping side pull and right on a down pulling soping edge. Work straight up avoiding dabbing the tree.
content.location: Continue walking pass the great wall. Or go Up the hill from Differentiation Derivatives

content.description: Start left on a sloppy ledge and right in a crack. work the crack to the top.
content.protection: A pad or two will do

content.description: Start on left the arete and right in the crack. Work both up with fun feet to topout
content.protection: Good landing a few pads will do

content.description: Mega king line. Start on Coffer and then head left through the thin edges and a high left gaston, then trend back right with a very long reach with really low or super high feet, through a horizontal that takes you to the arete bulge high and right. Trend left on jugs from this point to a very high topout.Â

This boulder can be reached by walking the ridge trail on your way in and dropping off midway to your left. You can also walk all the way to the point, and hang a left and circle back, passing Big Heist, etc. Start on far left of boulder and trend up and slightly left with some big slappy reaches.
Steep overhanging arete. The sit is probably V11 or 12.
content.location: If you're looking at the ridge point from below, this is on the left side of the ridge. Giant overhanging unmistakeable arete.
From the ridge point, continue straight trending down the hill and right. Boulder is on the left

content.description: Same start as Ironborn but go up direct.
Start on the same ledge as Mother May I Left and move straight up through nothing holds to a big move to the lip.
content.location: On the Mother May I boulder

content.description: Fantastic traversing arete line. Start all the way at the bottom and move through sustained, though not overly difficult individual moves, hugging the arete and culminating in a powerful throw at the finish.The stand-start (The Heist) is perhaps V8. There is also a mantle exit midway through from the sit start that is about v7 (The Getaway).
content.protection: Many pads are helpful, but the boulder is never more then 3-4 feet off the ground.
content.location: Once you drop down off the point of the ridge, if you turn around and look at the point of the ridge, The Big Heist will be off to the right, about 50 yards away. Big obvious, beautiful low arete.

content.description: Start with two hands on edge under the roof and a toehook on the right arete. Continue out to join the right arete. A lower true start is perhaps possible but quite hard.
content.protection: Pads - Can be a bit sketch since the roof gets somewhat high. Lots of pads is nice.
content.location: Once you drop off the ridge at the point, continue walking straight, and then slightly right and down hill. You'll pass Deriving Derivatives on your left and then hit a big roof.

content.description: Substantial bouldering area near the somewhat larger, more accessible, and much more well-known and popular Coll's Cove. There a number of very high quality lines on either side of a ridge on State Gamelands 51. This is a popular hunting area (more popular than Coll's), so wear requisite orange, consider going elsewhere during hunting seasons, etc.
